'''José María Miranda Boto''' is Professor of Labour Law at the University of Santiago de Compostela, Spain. He is the author of "El Derecho en Tolkien" (Cinca, [[2017]]) and "[[Law, Government, and Society in J.R.R. Tolkien's Works]]" ([[Walking Tree]], [[2022]]), for which he received the [[Mythopoeic Society|Mythopoeic Scholarship Award in Inklings Studies]] in [[2024]]. He has edited "Tolkien. Un clásico de nuestros días" (Legendaria, [[2024]]).

Since [[2023]], he has taught at the University of Vienna the course "Law and Literature: Law, Government, and Society in [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s Works". He has given lectures on Tolkien at universities in [[Spain]], [[Germany]], [[Austria]], [[France]] and [[Italy]], as well as at fan associations in Colombia and the [[United Kingdom|UK]]. He was a speaker at the Celsius 232 festival in Avilés. In [[2023]] he directed the summer course of the University of Santiago de Compostela "Tolkien. Un clásico dos nosos días".
